instructions:
In a 6 quart pot add ham hocks, bay leaf and onion with cloves to 5 cups of water. Cover and simmer for
1 hour.
In a 4 quart *(or larger)* Dutch oven add rinsed navy beans to 6 cups of water. Bring to a boil over high
heat and boil for 2 minutes. Remove from heat, cover and let stand for 1 hour. Drain beans and reserve
liquid.
Add drained beans and all remaining ingredients to the ham hock pot. Add 3 1/2 cups of the reserved
bean cooking liquid. Simmer covered for 1 1/2 hours.
Discard bay leaf and onion with cloves. Remove meat from ham hocks and coarse grind. Remove 3/4
cup of beans and mash for thickening. Return mashed beans and ground meat, and bring to a simmer for an
additional 20 to 30 minutes or until beans are tender. Makes 3 1/2 quarts. 
*(Rev. 5/22/00)*
ingredients: 1 lb dried navy beans, picked over and rinsed well
name: Senate Bean Soup
creator: Jim Decker
